main_definition: To be present at an event, place, or gathering.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take part in a meeting or conference.
meanings_and_examples.example: She will attend the annual business summit next week.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be present at an event for enjoyment.
meanings_and_examples.example: They attended the music concert together last night.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To listen to or give attention to something, such as a lecture or performance.
meanings_and_examples.example: The audience will attend his TED talk tomorrow evening.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To fulfill an obligation or commitment, like going to school or work.
meanings_and_examples.example: He attends college on weekdays and works part-time during the evenings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give support or assistance, often in a group setting such as charity events or meetings.
meanings_and_examples.example: We will attend the fundraising event for the local food bank.
